abstract_summ: The authors hypothesized that the choice of neuromuscular blockade reversal (neostigmine vs. sugammadex) may be associated with a lower incidence of major pulmonary complications . In a multicenter observational matched cohort study of noncardiac surgery, sugamadex administration was associated with 30% reduced risk of pulmonary complications, a 47% reduced . risk of pneumonia, and 55% risk of respiratory failure .
